description: Explore the fascinating world of scientific discoveries and natural phenomena

questions.question: What is H2O commonly known as?
questions.funFact: Water is the only natural substance found in all three states (solid, liquid, gas) at temperatures normally found on Earth.
questions.story: The term H2O was first coined by Antoine Lavoisier, known as the 'Father of Modern Chemistry', when he proved that water was made of hydrogen and oxygen in 1783.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.funFact: Mars appears red because its surface contains lots of iron oxide - the same compound that makes rust red!
questions.story: Ancient civilizations were fascinated by Mars' reddish appearance, leading the Romans to name it after their god of war, as its color reminded them of blood on the battlefield.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.funFact: All the gold ever mined in human history would fit into a cube with sides of just 21 meters!
questions.story: The symbol Au comes from the Latin word 'aurum', meaning 'shining dawn'. Ancient alchemists believed gold was formed by the power of the sun, as it shared its brilliant yellow color.
